1.q_string: Vertical columns in the periodic table starting from top to bottom are called:
If the valence shell electronic configuration for an element is \(\mathrm{ns}^2 \mathrm{np}^4\), this element belongs to the group of:
The elements with atomic numbers 4, 12, 20, 38 and 56 belong to the group of:

Element having electronic configuration \(1 \mathrm{s}^2, 2 \mathrm{s}^2, 2 \mathrm{p}^6, 3 \mathrm{s}^2, 3 \mathrm{p}^6, 3 \mathrm{d}^{10}, 4 \mathrm{s}^2, 4 \mathrm{p}^6, 4 \mathrm{d}^{10}, 5 \mathrm{s}^2, 5 \mathrm{p}^3\) belongs to the group in the periodic table:
Which of the following is not the name of the 104th element?
The element with atomic number \(Z=115\) will be placed in:
Which of the following elements is a metalloid?
The screening effect of \(s\) orbital electron is:
q_option: Greater than that of \(p\), but lesser than that of \(d\) and \(f\) electrons
Lesser than that of \(p, d\) and \(f\) electrons
Greater than that of \(p, d\) and \(f\) electrons
Equal to that of \(p, d\) and \(f\) electrons

1.q_string: The electronic configuration of four elements are given below. Which element does not belong to same family as others?
Diagonal relationship in a periodic table is present in:
q_option: All elements with their diagonally opposite elements.
Some elements of second and third periods
All elements of third and fourth periods

1.q_string: ____________ observed the X-rays’ characteristics.
The element whose electronic configuration is \(1 \mathrm{s}^2, 2 \mathrm{s}^2, 2 \mathrm{p}^6, 3 \mathrm{s}^2\) is:
What is the position of the element having outer electronic configuration \(n s^2 n p^4\) for \(n=3\)?
Among the elements \(\mathrm{Ca}, \mathrm{Mg}, \mathrm{P}\) and \(\mathrm{Cl}\), the order of increasing atomic radii is:
Which was the incomplete period in the long-form of the modern periodic table?
The first four ionization energy values of an element are 191, 578, 872 and 5962 Kcal. the number of valency electrons in the element is:
The Aufbau Principle states that:
q_option: Only two electrons can occupy an orbital
Electrons enter the lowest available energy level
Orbitals are regions in space where one is likely to find an electron

1.q_string: From the ground state of electronic configuration of various electrons, which will have the highest value of second ionisation energy?
Which one of the following is not a subatomic particle?

The atomic numbers of \(\mathrm{V}, \mathrm{Cr}, \mathrm{Mn}\) and \(\mathrm{Fe}\) are \(23, 24, 25\) and \(26\) respectively. Which one of these may be expected to have the highest second ionization enthalpy?
The period’s number corresponds to the highest _________.
What is the atomic number of element Unnilennium?

An element with atomic number 17 is placed in the group 17 of the long from periodic table. Element with atomic number 9 is placed above and with atomic number 35 is placed below it. Element with atomic number 16 is placed left and with atomic number 18 is placed right to it. Which of the following statements is not correct?
q_option: Valency of the element with atomic number 18 is zero.
Elements with same valency will have atomic number 16, 17 and 18.
Valency of element with atomic number 9, 17 and 35 is one.
Element with atomic number 17 is more electronegative than element with atomic number 16 and 35.

1.q_string: Electronic configuration of an element is:
q_option: The distribution of electrons into different atomic orbitals.
The distribution of electrons into magnetic states of an atom.
The distribution of electrons into spin state of an atom.
The distribution of electrons into azimuthal orbitals of an atom only.

1.q_string: An element belongs to the 3rd period and Group II of the periodic table. Name of the element is _____________.
The maximum number of electrons held in the \(d\) orbitals is:
The maximum number of electrons that can be accommodated in \(\mathrm{d}_{\mathrm{x}^2-\mathrm{y}^2}\) orbital is:
The \(d\)-block Elements are characterized by the:
Metalloids show the properties of:
q_option: Properties that are characteristic of both metals and plastics
Properties that are characteristic of both metals and non-metals.
Properties that are characteristic of both metals and gases
Properties that are characteristic of both metals and viscous liquids

1.q_string: Which of the following statements is false regarding alkali metals?
q_option: Alkali metals form covalent bonds with oxygen.
Alkali metals usually have a +1 oxidation state
Alkali metals forms oxides that act as basic anhydrides.
Alkali metals have relatively low first ionization energies
